classes.cCustomNote: One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, Upper-Division B, C1, C2, Lower-Division C Elective, Upper-Division C, D1, Upper-Division D, E, and GE Elective. Upper-Division B, Upper-Division C, and Upper-Division D should be taken only after junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to online catalog for GE course selection and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR).

Individualized Course of Study

300-400 level courses selected in consultation with advising faculty. A written justification for the courses selected and the way they constitute a cohesive, integrated study is required. One-half of the units must be course from the department.

If GE courses are taken for letter grade and used as concentration courses, additional free elective units may be required to complete the 180 total degree requirement. See college advisor for additional information.
